thread.title: Weather: Clear, but cold and dropping
thread.title_full: Weather: Clear, but cold and dropping | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: The Virginian-Pilot
title: Weather: Clear, but cold and dropping
text:
The days ahead will be clear but cold, according to the National Weather Service. High pressure building will drop temperatures in the region, the lowest being 43 tonight, incrementally growing to a low of 52 Tuesday night and 57 by Thursday.
During the daytime, it'll be in the 50s today, 60s Tuesday and low 70s Wednesday, according to the current forecast in Hampton Roads.
Elsewhere, freeze and frost warnings are in effect due to the lowering temperatures, in areas away from the water.
A freeze warning was issued Sunday for Suffolk, Isle of Wight County and the North Carolina counties of Bertie, Gates and Hertford. A frost advisory was issued in Chesapeake, Gloucester, James City and York counties and Camden, Chowan, Pasquotank and Perquimans counties in North Carolina.
South Hampton Roads residents should also look out for potential patchy frost or a light freeze when temperatures are lowest.
All the while, the sun will be shining.
